thread.title: The Biggest Loser Australia 2015: Who trains with Michelle Bridges and the other trainers? | DailyTelegraph
thread.title_full: The Biggest Loser Australia 2015: Who trains with Michelle Bridges and the other trainers? | DailyTelegraph

author: CHARLOTTE WILLIS
title: The Biggest Loser Australia 2015: Who trains with Michelle Bridges and the other trainers? | DailyTelegraph
text:
EVER wondered who has the stamina to keep up with Shannan? Who could cope with Commando’s coaching? Who tackles Tiffiny in taekwondo? And who motivates Michelle?
They’re the toughest, fittest trainers in the country, so you’d be forgiven for thinking the Biggest Loser coaches simply train themselves. But, it turns out even these four perfectly sculpted humans need an extra push from time to time, and they’re set to unleash their secret weapons on this season’s unknowing contestants.
Tonight on TBL Families , Shannan, Commando, Tiff and Michelle bring in the fitness gurus responsible for keeping them motivated.
Other Stories Partner explains why Thurston broke down Nrl 0 comments ‘I got three or four words in’ Us Sports Wayne trait that other coaches can’t stomach Nrl 0 comments Suburbs most at risk of mortgage default News 0 comments Watmough baby ‘beats the odds’ Sydney Confidential 0 comments Lana and Sarah live it up in Bali Sydney Confidential 0 comments The families are in for one brutal gym session.
Shannan Ponton introduces the blue team to August Vaifale.
The former professional boxer and rugby league player trained Shannan for his first professional boxing fight seven years ago. Vaifale is currently a strength and conditioning coach for Manly Rugby League Club and is a highly sought after sparing partner for those training for any big fight.
“August is an exceptional boxing technician and can pick apart and correct flaws in my technique concisely,” Shannan told news.com.au
“As an amazing boxer himself, he has the incredible ability to read situations and opponents’ body language in the ring. He sees things I miss constantly. August shouts directions and orders and without thinking and I instinctively react. You need to have that level of trust with your trainer.”
Shannan's new trainer 0:46 Twin sisters Jodie and Ali meet Shannan's new trainer.
September 29th 2015 7 hours ago /video/video.news.com.au/Entertainment/ Commando introduces the black team to training buddy Florien Locke.
Commando first met Locke when he wanted to start lifting bigger weights and improve on his strength. They’ve become good friends since.
Locke started gymnastics when he was five and competed for Germany in the Junior Olympics. He then won the European championships on the rings.
In 2014, he smashed the world record in powerlifting by lifting 220.5kgs.
“I train with a coach from time to time to help with specific areas that I feel need improvement, such as Olympic Lifting, powerlifting and CrossFit,” Commando said.
“I have trained with a mate of mine for a number of years focusing on strength and power movements. We meet at a gym I first started working at when I left the Army in 2005.”
Commando's new trainer 0:39 Commando introduces the Black Team to his new trainer.
September 29th 2015 7 hours ago /video/video.news.com.au/Entertainment/ Tiffiny Hall welcomes a very special training partner, her sister Bridget.
From the moment they could crawl, the pair were learning the ins and outs of taekwondo in their parents’ dojo, earning black belts by the time they were 11.
As well as looking alike, the sisters — who are just two years apart — are extremely close. They have the same friendship groups, travel together and still hit the gym when they can.
“When Bridget and I are travelling, we train together and use each other as equipment. It’s quite interesting. It sounds a bit weird, but it works,” Tiff said.
“We do leg presses and ab work with each other. It just shows you don’t need fancy equipment and you can work out anywhere, anytime — no excuses.”
Tiffiny's new trainer 0:52 Tiffiny introduces her team to her new trainer, her sister Bridget.
September 29th 2015 7 hours ago /video/video.news.com.au/Entertainment/ Michelle Bridges brings in Joey Sheather to put the red team through their paces.
Sheather is the secret weapon behind Bridges and the fitness fanatics have known each other for more than 15 years.
With over 20 years in the industry, the master trainer, natural bodybuilder and resistance training expert has devoted 18 years and 23,000 hours in the gym experimenting, creating and refining training techniques to help his clients.
The trainers’ training buddies will appear on the show during tonight’s episode, 7.30pm on Ten.
Michelle's new trainer 0:26 Michelle's team is introduced to her newest trainer.
September 29th 2015 7 hours ago /video/video.news.com.au/Entertainment/ Originally published as Who trains the Biggest Loser trainers?
